pr_title: Adding core RetryInterceptor that honors CancellationToken.cancel(), enables Fixed and Expotential stratgies

timeline.message: Adding core RetryInterceptor that honors CancellationToken.cancel(), enables Fixed and Expotential stratgies

timeline.bodyText: Nit: Do we want to use cancelled or canceled? I know both are correct but just want to know which one we prefer for the sake of consistency.
timeline.author: vcolin7

replies.bodyText:
I preferred "Cancell****" for our "Type Names" mainly because the same is used in well-known CancellationToken.
Our types are:

CancellationToken (public)
CancellationTokenImpl (internal)
ExceptionUtils.CALL_CANCELLED_IO_EXCEPTION (internal)

The reason we used Canceled in the "Exception message" of IOException("Canceled.") which we throw onCancel is to consistent with what OkHttp throws from its stack under the same condition, refer this, basically, we don't want customers to string match two different strings in case they have any logic based on the error message.
replies.author: anuchandy

replies.bodyText: I see, I agree that it makes sense to be consistent with OkHttp. I don't have a strong opinion on using either, however, I think we should have a default for every other case. I'll bring up with the team.
replies.author: vcolin7

replies.bodyText:
thanks, Victor! with* is good with me.
One thing we might want to consider later is, is it better if we use createWith*? two reasons:

This is a factory method, so create is a common prefix.
The prefix with is a common prefix used to qualify setters in the builder/fluent pattern e.g. here.

but we can revisit it later but what you proposed is better than the current naming.

replies.bodyText: I'm also ok with using createWith, maybe we can bring this up in our next meeting :)
